abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column discusses Village Voice Media's classified network Backpage.com, which includes a sex-oriented section, as a freedom of speech issue; points out that in August, the country’s 51 attorneys general sent a letter demanding that Backpage.com close the section, noting that it has on occasion been used to offer minors for sex.
snippet: In August, the country’s 51 attorneys general sent a letter demanding that Backpage.com close its sex-oriented section, and now a coalition of religious leaders has joined that effort.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Center for Missing and Exploited Children

lead_paragraph: In August, the country’s 51 attorneys general sent a letter demanding that Backpage.com close its sex-oriented section, and now a coalition of religious leaders has joined that effort.

headline.seo: Backpage.com Confronts New Fight Over Online Sex Ads
